item.description:
Get out on your bike in a fun atmosphere of celebration!

In honor of Earth Day, Green Streets is organizing a Great Bike Parade for Sunday, April 27th, from 1-2 pm (in conjunction with the Bicycle Coalition of Maine?s Great Bike Swap and the Portland Bicycle Commuter Meetup).

This is a fun event for all ages and abilities! The parade will run in a loop from the Swap at USM?s Sullivan Gym, down to and around the Back Cove Trail, and then return to the Swap (complete with police escort! :). Check out this map of the 4-mile route.

Please bring your friends, family, and bikes (and/or look for a bike at the Swap!) and join us! (And feel free to use any other human-powered vehicle (tricycle, wheel-chair, pedicab, etc)! Come celebrate the most efficient form of transportation humans have ever created!

If you'd like, go ahead and have some fun decorating your bike, and/or posting it with signs that promote bike riding (and we'll have a bike decorating station at the Swap, too!) There will be prizes for riders: Youngest Rider, Eldest Rider, Most Original Decorated Bike, Most Earth Day-Related Decorated Bike, and Most Flamboyant Decorated Bike. So go wild with the decorating!
item.how_to_find_us: We're meeting in the parking lot of the Sullivan Gym.
item.why: You'll meet lots of cool people and have a great time riding around the back bay.
item.name: Family Bicycle Parade
